problemSolution.headline: The Real Cost of Broken Systems
problemSolution.subheadline: Your team is talented. Your tools are holding them back.

fragmentation.problem: Information scattered across 6+ tools. Nothing talks to each other. Team spends hours searching for context.
fragmentation.solution: One workspace. All your data connected. Everything your team needs in a single source of truth.

manual.problem: Manual data entry. Copy-pasting between systems. Repetitive tasks eating 10+ hours per week.
manual.solution: Automated workflows that move data for you. Your team focuses on decisions, not busywork.

scaling.problem: Growing means hiring more people to do the same repetitive work. Revenue up, margins flat.
scaling.solution: Systems that scale without headcount. Growth doesn't require proportional hiring.

process.title: How It Works
process.subtitle: A clear, structured process from initial audit to full implementation.

step1.title: Operational diagnosis
step1.description: We map your current processes; tools and recurring problems. The goal is to see how work really flows today; not how it is supposed to work on paper.

step2.title: System architecture
step2.description: We design how your business should run as a system; where information lives; how tasks move; what gets automated and what leadership needs to see every day.

step3.title: Build and automation
step3.description: We turn the architecture into real Notion workspaces and n8n workflows; shipped in small slices you can test with real work; not demo data.

step4.title: Rollout and support
step4.description: We roll out the system with your team; refine what does not feel natural and stay close during the first weeks so adoption is smooth and the system sticks.

items.quote: I engaged Beyker to help structure and automate several operational workflows. What stood out immediately was his ability to listen, understand the underlying pain points, and translate needs into working solutions. Beyker didn't just configure tools - he mapped out systems and processes so I could hit the ground running from day one. He's exceptionally resourceful, whether building direct integrations or finding creative workarounds when standard connections don't exist. His knowledge spans the full productivity stack: Notion, Make, N8N, and most current platforms. Beyond technical expertise, Beyker is a true partner. He takes feedback seriously, iterates quickly, and isn't satisfied until everything actually works the way you need it to. He'll invest the extra time to get processes right rather than deliver something functional but incomplete. If you're looking for someone who can integrate systems, automate workflows, and build scalable infrastructure across platforms, Beyker is the resource you need. I highly recommended him.
items.author: Vincent Socci

items.quote: I worked with Beyker on the creation and improvement of a Notion dashboard to manage my work as a coach. We started with an initial version and then evolved it into a much clearer, more functional 2.0, fully aligned with the way I work. I especially value his ability to understand real needs, propose practical improvements, and turn complex processes into simple, usable systems. Thanks to his work, I achieved greater organization, focus, and efficiency in my day-to-day work. I fully recommend him to anyone looking for well-thought-out, personalized Notion solutions.
items.author: Inge Yang

items.quote: It is always a pleasure to meet with fellow technology enthusiasts who have the tools to help improve workflow within an organization and who understand the needs of today's market. At Tu Naranja Digital, we are committed to innovation and continuous improvement. When we began working with Beyker, we realized that we shared these values. We are very happy with the relationship we have. He is a valuable partner who helps us achieve our goals. I would highly recommend Beyker to any company looking to improve its technology and processes.
items.author: Alvaro Diaz

faqPreview.headline: Common Questions
faqPreview.subheadline: Everything you need to know before booking your audit.

question1.q: What's included in the $150 Systems Audit?
question1.a: A 60-minute deep-dive call where we map your current systems and pain points, a complete workspace audit, and a detailed report showing what's broken, what to fix first, and exactly how much it would cost to build. 50% of audit clients move to implementation.

question2.a: Systems Audit: 1 week. Business Operating System: 6-8 weeks. Ultimate Business OS: 8-10 weeks. All timelines include team training and documentation. You'll see progress in weekly increments, not at the end.

question3.q: Will my team actually use this, or will it collect dust?
question3.a: Every system is built around your team's actual workflows, not generic templates. Training is included. Documentation is clear. Most teams are fully onboarded within 2 weeks because the system is designed for them, not against them.

question4.q: What if we need changes after the project is done?
question4.a: All projects include 2-4 weeks of post-launch support for adjustments. After that, you can handle most changes yourself (everything is documented), or you can book ad-hoc hours or establish a retainer for ongoing work.

question1.q: What's the difference between a one-time project and a retainer?
question1.a: One-time projects have a defined scope and end date. Retainers provide ongoing support, iteration, and optimization of your systems.

question2.q: Do you work with n8n, Zapier, or Make?
question2.a: Yes, all three. I choose the best platform based on your needs, technical requirements, and budget.

question3.a: Timelines vary by scope. A Business OS typically takes 6-8 weeks. Smaller automation projects can be completed in 2-3 weeks.

faqPage.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqPage.subtitle: Everything you need to know about working together, from process to pricing.

questions.question: What types of businesses do you work with?
questions.answer: I work with growing teams, agencies, and startups across industries. Most clients are between 5-50 people and need systems to scale operations without proportional headcount growth.

questions.question: Do you work with clients remotely?
questions.answer: Yes, all projects are conducted remotely. Most clients are in the US and Europe, but I've worked with teams worldwide.

questions.question: How do I get started?
questions.answer: The best starting point is either a Systems Audit (if you're exploring options) or booking a call to discuss your specific needs. Both options help us determine the right approach.

questions.question: Do you only work in Notion?
questions.answer: Notion is my primary platform for Business Operating Systems, but I work with other tools when they're the right fit. The goal is choosing the best solution for your needs, not forcing everything into Notion.

questions.question: Can you migrate data from our current system into Notion?
questions.answer: Yes, data migration is typically included in Business OS projects. We assess your current data, clean it up, and migrate what's relevant to the new system.

questions.question: What if our team doesn't know how to use Notion?
questions.answer: Team training is included in all Notion projects. Most teams become comfortable within a week of daily use. Documentation and training videos are also provided.

questions.question: Which automation platform should I use: n8n, Zapier, or Make?
questions.answer: It depends on your technical capabilities, budget, and specific needs. n8n offers the most flexibility but requires some technical setup. Zapier is user-friendly with extensive integrations. Make is powerful and cost-effective for complex workflows. I help choose the right platform during scoping.

questions.question: Do I need technical skills to maintain automations?
questions.answer: No. All automations include documentation and are designed to be maintainable by non-technical users. Error notifications are set up so you know when something breaks.

questions.question: What happens if an automation breaks?
questions.answer: All projects include 30-60 days of post-launch support for bug fixes and adjustments. This ensures automations work reliably before handover.

questions.question: How long does implementation take?
questions.answer: Systems Audits: 1-2 weeks. Business Operating System: 6-8 weeks. Ultimate Business OS: 8-12 weeks. Timelines depend on project scope and your team's availability for feedback.

questions.question: Do you offer payment plans?
questions.answer: Yes, projects over $2,500 can be split into milestone-based payments.

questions.question: What's included in post-launch support?
questions.answer: All projects include 30-60 days of post-launch support for bug fixes and minor adjustments. This ensures the system works as expected before handover.

questions.question: What's your refund policy?
questions.answer: Systems Audits come with a money-back guarantee if you're not satisfied. For implementation projects, we work in phases with milestone approvals to ensure alignment throughout the process.

questions.question: Will our team be able to maintain the system after you're done?
questions.answer: Yes. All projects include training and documentation designed for non-technical users. Systems are built to be maintained by your team, not dependent on me.

questions.question: What if we need changes after the project is complete?
questions.answer: Minor changes are covered during the support period (30-60 days). After that, you can book ad-hoc hours as needed for adjustments or new features.

questions.question: Do you provide training for our team?
questions.answer: Yes. Training sessions are included in all Business OS projects. The Ultimate Business OS includes extended training (3 sessions) to ensure your team is fully comfortable with the system.

whoIsThisFor.title: Who Is This For?
points: You're overwhelmed by scattered tools and manual processes but don't know where to start
You've tried productivity systems before but they never stick with your team
You want to invest in the right solution without wasting money on the wrong approach
You need an outside perspective on what's actually broken (and costing you time/money)
You're considering Notion or automation but want expert guidance before committing

items.title: 60-Minute Deep-Dive Consultation
items.description: We'll walk through your current systems, workflows, and pain points. I'll ask the right questions to understand what's working, what's broken, and what's holding you back.

items.title: Complete Workspace Audit
items.description: I'll review your existing tools, databases, automations, and workflows. If you have Notion, I'll audit your workspace structure, database architecture, and automation setup.

items.title: Comprehensive Written Report
items.description: You'll receive a detailed report identifying what's broken, prioritized recommendations, implementation roadmap, and cost/time estimates for each recommendation.

items.title: Custom Implementation Quote
items.description: If you want to move forward, you'll get a tailored proposal for implementation. No pressureâ€”you own the report and can use it however you like.

steps.title: Book Your Audit
steps.description: Choose a time that works for you. You'll receive a pre-audit questionnaire to maximize our session time.

steps.title: Pre-Audit Prep
steps.description: Fill out a brief questionnaire about your current setup, biggest pain points, and goals. This helps me come prepared with specific questions.

steps.title: Live Audit Session
steps.description: We meet for 60 minutes via video call. I'll review your systems, ask clarifying questions, and identify opportunities in real-time.

steps.title: Report Delivery
steps.description: Within 3-5 business days, you'll receive your comprehensive audit report with findings, recommendations, and next steps.

steps.title: Optional Follow-Up
steps.description: If you want to move forward, we'll schedule a follow-up call to discuss implementation. No obligationâ€”the report is yours either way.

whatHappensAfter.title: What Happens After the Audit?
whatHappensAfter.description: You have complete flexibility. Here are your options:
options: Use the report to fix things yourself (everything is documented clearly)
Hire me to implement the recommended solutions (audit fee is credited toward project)
Share the report with your team or another consultant
Just sit on itâ€”there's no expiration date or obligation

items.question: What if I don't use Notion yet?
items.answer: No problem. The audit covers your entire operational setupâ€”whatever tools you're currently using. I'll assess whether Notion is even the right fit for you.

items.question: Is this just a sales call?
items.answer: No. This is a paid consultation that delivers real value whether you hire me or not. You'll walk away with actionable insights and a clear roadmap.

items.question: Can I get a refund if I'm not satisfied?
items.answer: Yes. If you're not satisfied with the audit, I'll refund you in full. No questions asked.

items.question: How soon can we schedule?
items.answer: Typically within 3-5 business days. If you need it sooner, let me know and I'll do my best to accommodate.

items.question: What do I need to prepare?
items.answer: Just access to your current tools and systems. I'll send a brief questionnaire after booking to help structure our conversation.

testimonial.title: What Clients Say
testimonial.text: Beyker was excellent to work with. He completed a thorough review of our Notion setup and database templates, delivering clear insights and practical recommendations. His communication was professional and responsive throughout the engagement, and he met all project milestones on time. His expertise in Notion and no-code systems was evident in the quality of his work. He approached the assignment with attention to detail and a genuine understanding of our organizational needs. Highly recommended.
testimonial.author: Vincent Socci, Co-President & COO, William Pitt Sotheby's International Realty

howWeWork.title: How We Work
howWeWork.description: Every project follows a proven methodology designed to deliver results, not just deliverables. Here's exactly what happens when you work with me.

steps.title: Discovery & Analysis
steps.description: We start by understanding your business, workflows, and pain points. I ask questions, review your current systems, and identify what's actually brokenâ€”not what you think is broken.

steps.title: Architecture & Design
steps.description: I design a system architecture tailored to your specific needs. This isn't about forcing you into a templateâ€”it's about building something that fits your actual workflow.

steps.title: Build & Development
steps.description: I build your solution according to the approved design. Regular checkpoint reviews ensure we stay aligned. You see progress, not radio silence.

steps.title: Testing & Refinement
steps.description: Before launch, I test edge cases, validate error handling, and ensure everything works as expected. If something breaks, I fix it before you see it.

steps.title: Training & Handoff
steps.description: I train your team on how to use the system. Live sessions, clear documentation, and Q&A to ensure smooth adoption. No "figure it out yourself" approach.

steps.title: Support & Optimization
steps.description: Post-launch support means I don't disappear. I monitor usage, fix issues, and make adjustments based on real-world feedback from your team.

items.title: No Vendor Lock-In
items.description: You own everything. Full access to all workspaces, automations, and documentation. No ongoing dependency.

items.title: Built for Your Team
items.description: Systems designed around your workflowsâ€”not forcing you to adapt to generic templates.

items.title: Transparency Always
items.description: Clear pricing, realistic timelines, and honest communication. No surprises, no hidden costs.
